text: Infra newb question: IIUC `<https://julialangnightlies.s3.amazonaws.com/src/1.6/julia-latest-full.tar.gz>` maps to the  `release-1.6`  branch (?). Is there an equivalent for the  `release-1.5`  branch? To answer these sorts of questions independently, where should I be looking apart from <https://github.com/JuliaCI/julia-buildbot/blob/master/master/builder_utils.py>? :slightly_smiling_face:

text: I believe nightlies like are only retained for 30 (60?) days so unless there have been a build from the release-1.5 branch in that time I guess it doesn't exist.

elements.text: I believe nightlies like are only retained for 30 (60?) days so unless there have been a build from the release-1.5 branch in that time I guess it doesn't exist.

text: Unfortunately you can’t see things like our S3 bucket settings (Which auto-delete things after N days) because there’s no public way to expose those settings, I don’t think

elements.text: Unfortunately you can’t see things like our S3 bucket settings (Which auto-delete things after N days) because there’s no public way to expose those settings, I don’t think

text: To check my understanding, when the open backports-release-1.5 branch (or any other branch targeting release-1.5) merges, that will trigger a build, the result of which will be cached for some 30-60 or so days at <https://julialangnightlies.s3.amazonaws.com/src/1.5/julia-latest-full.tar.gz>? :slightly_smiling_face:
